title: Nilmanifold
summary: In mathematics,  a nilmanifold is a differentiable manifold which has a transitive nilpotent group of diffeomorphisms acting on it.  As such, a nilmanifold is an example of a homogeneous space and is diffeomorphic to the quotient space N / H {\displaystyle N/H} , the quotient of a nilpotent Lie group N modulo a closed subgroup H.  This notion was introduced by Anatoly Mal'cev in 1951.
